subject: Climate & Environment
title: Composting and Organic Recycling
description: A fast breakdown of Composting and Organic Recycling for builders.

hook.text: Food scraps and yard waste make up over 30% of what we throw away. All of it is compostable.

buildup.text: Composting turns organic waste into nutrient-rich soil that helps plants grow.

discovery.text: It also prevents methane emissions that would occur if the same waste rotted in a landfill.

twist.text: San Francisco mandates composting for every household and business. It diverts 80% of waste from landfill.

climax.text: Home composting is simple. Even small apartments can use indoor worm bins for food scraps.

punchline.text: Trash becomes soil. Waste becomes food. The cycle is right there.

quiz.question: What percentage of household waste is organic and compostable?
